channel.title: Tos
channel.description:
Hey guys, i had to agree to the TOS of moparscape, in the corner of my eye i caught this.
[code]3. You do not currently play runescape, or any other Jagex game, and are therefore not subject to their TOS or any other agreement with them.[/code]
Why do they have this if the community IS playing RuneScape?

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Loveandpower:

which is exactly my point. On RuneScape, you break the tos, Jagex reserves the righ tto ban you. All that happens on here is you get redirected elsewhere. If you do accept the terms does not mean they have to be followed. Perfect example: runescape discussion. You can’t claim that we are breaking one tos without breaking rs’s tos. We are breaching RS’s tos by discussing RS for hacks and such. Anything that is against jagex’s rules and if we discuss it anywhere then we have breached their terms. If we discuss anything about mopar elsewhere what are the punishments? none. What happens if we discuss RS on here? What happens if Jagex clicks yes they agree and then posts on here? nothing. You see where I am getting at?

It comes down to what will hold up in court and what will not. TOS basically work like EULAs, minus legal enforcement. However, in mopar’s case, his website condones illegal activity. It’s not that his website violates Jagex’s TOS (which is irrelevant), it’s that it breaks laws. The TOS does nothing to protect the website from doing illegal activity. Just because mopar has a few words that you are required to say ‘yes’ to doesn’t mean you and him can start doing illegal stuff safely. That doesn’t even make sense. All it means is that if you break something on there, you can be removed from the site (goes for both). Granted, mopar can remove you from his site anyway, just like Jagex can (since it says in their TOS they reserve the right to disable your account for any reason).

So really, there’s no point in having a TOS on any of these sites, other than to maybe stop indexing (which can be done with robots anyway). Jagex has a point in having a TOS, but it can’t be used more than an exhibit of violating in the court of law.

IANAL, but it seems straightforward enough to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

which is exactly my point. On RuneScape, you break the tos, Jagex reserves the righ tto ban you. All that happens on here is you get redirected elsewhere. If you do accept the terms does not mean they have to be followed. Perfect example: runescape discussion. You can’t claim that we are breaking one tos without breaking rs’s tos. We are breaching RS’s tos by discussing RS for hacks and such. Anything that is against jagex’s rules and if we discuss it anywhere then we have breached their terms. If we discuss anything about mopar elsewhere what are the punishments? none. What happens if we discuss RS on here? What happens if Jagex clicks yes they agree and then posts on here? nothing. You see where I am getting at?

Read full topic

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:19, topic:432041”][quote author=Niall link=topic=534748.msg3912849#msg3912849 date=1328917012]

Our TOS means nothing though.

and jagex’s tos means nothing

you have it in your head that jagex tos is legally binding while mopar’s tos means nothing, either all tos are legally binding or none of them are, that’s just how it works

and while tos are technically legally binding contracts, for all intents and purposes they aren’t legally binding, all they can do is enforce the rights the person, company or website already had

FOR INSTANCE, jagex can’t do shit about users discussing or using cheats beyond banning them from runescape or the jagex websites, unless of course it breaks real world laws in which case it has nothing to do with a tos anymore
[/quote]Etc. With our tos it just says you can’t do this this this this and this. It never says WHAT the punishment is.[/quote]

failing to agree to the tos redirects you to a page stating you cannot view this website without agreeing to the tos

no “punishment” is required for it to be legally binding

Read full topic

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=534748.msg3912614#msg3912614 date=1328903203]Our TOS means nothing though.

and jagex’s tos means nothing

you have it in your head that jagex tos is legally binding while mopar’s tos means nothing, either all tos are legally binding or none of them are, that’s just how it works

and while tos are technically legally binding contracts, for all intents and purposes they aren’t legally binding, all they can do is enforce the rights the person, company or website already had

FOR INSTANCE, jagex can’t do shit about users discussing or using cheats beyond banning them from runescape or the jagex websites, unless of course it breaks real world laws in which case it has nothing to do with a tos anymore[/quote]but you see the tos are just the “rules/punishments” sort of. It says if you cheat…you get banned. If you bot…you get banned. Etc. With our tos it just says you can’t do this this this this and this. It never says WHAT the punishment is. Therefore, their tos is an actual binding agreement because when you go to their game then they expect you not to cheat etc without getting banned. When your on mopar you agree you dont play RS but it means nothing. You agree you are not a jagex employee…okay none of us are that lucky so yeah. You see my point? If any of us were Jagex employees we would probably be fired from Jagex unless we were told to go to this site.

Read full topic

Unfortunately, he not only condones the ‘illegal’ behavior, but also participates. Summary: everyone’s fucked.[/quote]Our TOS means nothing though. All Jagex would have to do is get the court to order for the administrators to pass over site information of all users…we would all be instantly banned on RS that easily.

Therefore we can’t be encouraging you to break the runescape tos, when runescape players aren’t even allowed here.

Get it?[/quote]mopar tos still does not mean anything. Jagex’s is binding but we are breaking it no matter what by posting here. -laughs and points at jagex- breaking your tos!!

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Our TOS is about as legally binding as saying “don’t eat the last slice of pizza” to a friend. You can be mad at them all you want, but you can’t sue someone for taking the last slice.
